Package repository

Class BaseRepository

java.lang.Object
repository.BaseRepository
Direct Known Subclasses:
IslandRepository, ItemRepository, PirateRepository, SailorRepository, ShipRepository, StoreRepository, UnfortunateWeatherRepository, UpgradeRepository
public abstract class BaseRepository
extends java.lang.Object
An Abstract class that represents a Basic Repository.It helps mocking a Database to create the Entities used in the project(Ship, Island, Store, Item and so on). Used to read the CSV files, which contains information to build these Entities. Each line in the CSV file is used to build an object, with each String in the file representing a property of some object in the project, i.e Item or Store. As the first three informations of each line repeat, they belong to the base repository ID_NUMBER, NAME, DESCRIPTION. Other properties that will vary will be treated in each particular repository.
Author:
Maria Heloisa Balzaretti

    Constructors

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type Method Description
    abstract java.util.ArrayList<? extends Entity> getList()
    This method enforce that every classRepository that uses the baseRepository to create its own arrayList of type Entity and return the Array with the proper type, i.e ItemRepository will be used to read the files and return an ArrayList of all Items in the database, to be added to the Stores later.
    java.util.List<java.util.List<java.lang.String>> getResultListfromFile​(java.lang.String filePath)
    This method is used to read the CSV files.

    Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

    equals, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

  • Method Details

    • getResultListfromFile

      public java.util.List<java.util.List<java.lang.String>> getResultListfromFile​(java.lang.String filePath)
      This method is used to read the CSV files.
      Parameters:
      filePath - is the filepath of the CSV files with the relevant information to build the objects.
      Returns:
      a resulting list that contains sublists of Strings that are separated by a comma.

    • getList

      public abstract java.util.ArrayList<? extends Entity> getList()
      This method enforce that every classRepository that uses the baseRepository to create its own arrayList of type Entity and return the Array with the proper type, i.e ItemRepository will be used to read the files and return an ArrayList of all Items in the database, to be added to the Stores later.
      Returns:
      ArrayList of the necessary Entity
